Function Documentation

template<class T>
void ArrayTable< T >::resize ( unsigned  d0,
int  dummy = 0 
) [inline, inherited]

Modifies the size of a 1-dimensional array.

This method changes the size of an existing array. The previous content is destroyed.

Parameters:
d0 New size in the first dimension, i.e. size of first argument of the array
dummy Has no effect, is only introduced due to consistency with class Array
Returns:
none
Author:
M. Toussaint
Date:
2000
Changes
none
Status
stable

void ArrayIndex::resize ( unsigned  i,
bool  cp = false 
) [inline, inherited]

Resizes the calling index array to the new size "i" and keeps the old content if "cp" is set to "true".

Parameters:
i the new size of the index array
cp if set to "true", the old content of the index array is kept if possible, otherwise it is erased.
Returns:
none
Author:
D. Homberg
Date:
????
Changes
2002-03-14, ra: Swapped the instructions from the then and else part of the conditional, because otherwise the old content of the index array is not kept if the copy-flag is set to "true". Also added the occupation pointer ("pos") reset in the new else part.
Status
stable
See also:
add

Reimplemented from ArrayBase.

Definition at line 597 of file ArrayIndex.h.

References Array< unsigned >::e, Array< unsigned >::eEnd, ArrayBase::ne, ArrayIndex::pos, and Array< unsigned >::resize_i().

void ArrayIndex::resize ( const ArrayIndex &  ai  )  [inline, inherited]

Resizes the calling index array to the size of the index array "ai".

If the occupation pointer value pos of the calling index array is greater than the occupation pointer value of ai, it will be set to the occupation pointer value of ai.

Returns:
none
Author:
D. Homberg
Date:
????
Changes
2002-03-14, ra: The occupation pointer "pos" was set wrong, when "ai" had less elements than the calling array. This error was fixed by adding the conditional.
Status
stable
See also:
add

Definition at line 558 of file ArrayIndex.h.

References Array< unsigned >::e, Array< unsigned >::eEnd, ArrayBase::nelem(), ArrayIndex::pos, and ArrayBase::resize().

void ArrayIndex::resize (  )  [inline, inherited]

Resizes the index array for method add by adding at least memory for one element and also some extra memory depending on the number of elements stored in the index array.

Each resize operation consumes calculation time. If you're e.g. calling the add method many times, then a normal resize method would be called many times, too. To prevent this behaviour, this resize method always allocates some extra memory that is of the number of elements stored in the index array.

Returns:
none
Author:
D. Homberg
Date:
????
Changes
none
Status
stable
See also:
add

Referenced by ArrayIndex::add(), and ArrayIndex::setPos().

void ArrayBase::resize ( const ArrayBase &  v,
bool  copy = false 
) [inline, inherited]

Resizes an array to the dimensions of array "v".

The new dimensions of the current array are adopted from the dimensions of array v.
When the copy flag is set, then existing elements are copied (if possible), otherwise all existing elements are discarded.

Parameters:
v the array which dimensions are taken as new dimensions of the current array.
copy if set to "true", then existing elements of the current array are copied, otherwise they are discarded.
Returns:
none
Exceptions:
check_exception the type of the exception will be "size mismatch" and indicates, that you've tried to resize a static array reference and the new size is not equal to the old size
Author:
M. Kreutz
Date:
1995-01-01
Changes
none
Status
stable
See also:
resize_i(unsigned*, unsigned, bool)

void ArrayBase::resize ( const std::vector< unsigned > &  i,
bool  copy = false 
) [inline, inherited]

Resizes an array to an array with dimensions defined in vector "i".

When the copy flag is set, then existing elements are copied (if possible), otherwise all existing elements are discarded.

Parameters:
i the vector with the sizes of the different dimensions of the array.
copy if set to "true", then existing elements are copied, otherwise they are discarded.
Returns:
none
Exceptions:
check_exception the type of the exception will be "size mismatch" and indicates, that you've tried to resize a static array reference and the new size is not equal to the old size

void ArrayBase::resize ( unsigned  i,
unsigned  j,
unsigned  k,
bool  copy = false 
) [inline, inherited]

Resizes an array to a three-dimensional array of size i x j x k.

When the copy flag is set, then existing elements are copied (if possible), otherwise all existing elements are discarded.

Parameters:
i the size of the array in dimension one.
j the size of the array in dimension two.
k the size of the array in dimension three.
copy if set to "true", then existing elements are copied, otherwise they are discarded.
Returns:
none
Exceptions:
check_exception the type of the exception will be "size mismatch" and indicates, that you've tried to resize a static array reference and the new size is not equal to the old size
